article.description: Jalen Jordan had 18 points and three steals in 26 minutes and St. Francis Brooklyn cruised to an 88-67 win over Division III member SUNY Maritime on Saturday.
article.headline: St. Francis Brooklyn cruises past SUNY Maritime 88-67
article.linkText: St. Francis Brooklyn cruises past SUNY Maritime 88-67
article.story: NEW YORK -- Jalen Jordan had 18 points and three steals in 26 minutes and St. Francis Brooklyn cruised to an 88-67 win over Division III member SUNY Maritime on Saturday. Josh Nicholas added 14 points for the Terriers (3-8), who snapped a three-game losing streak. Chauncey Hawkins scored 11 and Milija Cosic had 10 points and nine boards. St. Francis Brooklyn made 7 of 11 from 3-point range in the first half when it built a 56-29 lead. The Terriers never trailed after an early 6-5 deficit and had their largest lead at 30 on the opening basket of the second half. Isaiah Hayes had 17 points and 12 rebounds to lead the Privateers, who outscored St. Francis Brooklyn 38-32 in the second half. Patrick MacDonald and Brendan McGovern added 10 each. The game counted as an exhibition for SUNY Maritime.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
